items.title: Uneven Footing for Spot Natural Gas as Northeast Retreats, Other Hubs Gain
items.summary: Cash natural gas markets were mixed Tuesday as a brief warming trend kept Northeast prices under pressure, while most other regional hubs posted modest rebounds following losses in the prior session.

items.title: Natural Gas Futures Crushed by Mild Weather, Curve Signals More Pain
items.summary: Weather stayed firmly in the driver’s seat Tuesday, pushing natural gas futures lower for a fifth consecutive session as shrinking heating demand weighed on the February contract.

items.title: Midday Snapshot: Natural Gas Spot Prices Mixed as Spring-like Temps Provide Pressure
items.summary: Natural gas physical markets traded mixed into midday Tuesday as sharp declines in the Northeast were offset by gains across much of the Lower 48.

items.title: Dawn Natural Gas Prices Slip Below $3 as Ontario Market Loosens
items.summary: Ontario’s Dawn cash prices fell below $3.00/MMBtu on Monday, a low not seen since October, as moderating weather finally curbed the season’s early demand surge.

items.title: Cold Snap, LNG Demand Lift January Bidweek as Henry Hub Nears $4.70; California Prices Buck Trend
items.summary: Although brief, a year-end cold snap during January bidweek trading lent support to the majority of U.S. natural gas prices, an NGI analysis found.

items.title: Mexico Power Plan Signals Steady Natural Gas Demand as Imports Creep Higher
items.summary: Natural gas is expected to remain the backbone of Mexico’s electricity sector for at least the next five years as the country’s fleet of combined-cycle power plants continues to grow, according to energy ministry Sener.

items.title: Favorable FERC Environmental Assessment Clears Path for Enhanced Southeast NatGas Transport, Reliability
items.summary: FERC staff said approval of compressor station works planned by Gulf South Pipeline Co. LLC would not significantly affect the quality of the human environment, with appropriate mitigating measures.

items.title: Minnesota Power Pulls out of NTEC Natural Gas Project Amid Legal Delays
items.summary: Minnesota Power has terminated its agreement to purchase electricity from the proposed Nemadji Trail Energy Center (NTEC), ending its involvement in the 550 MW natural gas plant planned for Superior, WI.

items.title: Afternoon Pulse: Natural Gas Futures Bounce Off Lows
items.summary: Natural gas futures pared earlier declines into midday Tuesday even as near-term warmth and softer LNG demand kept pressure on prices.

items.title: U.S. Natural Gas Outpacing Oil Demand as Data Centers, LNG Seen Lifting ‘26 Outlook
items.summary: After a year marked by macroeconomic pressures, geopolitical volatility and tighter margins, the U.S. oil and natural gas industry has shown resilience by doubling down on innovations, capital discipline and efficiency, according to a Deloitte expert

items.title: Oil Eyes Supply Disruptions as Venezuela Rebuild Talk Falls Flat
items.summary: Oil inches higher as traders are more focused on short term effects of the Venezuela oil blockade than longer term supply additions. Trump’s Venezuela Shock Jolts Energy Markets Awake - Trump’s ouster of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro has breath

items.title: Mexico’s Crude Exports Slide as Refining Finally Reawakens
items.summary: Mexico’s crude oil exports are shrinking fast – and this time the decline is not just a symptom of upstream exhaustion. Average crude exports have fallen from about 1.1 million b/d in 2020 to roughly 665,000 b/d in 2025, a near 40% drop. In December

items.title: UK North Sea Oil Enters Survival Mode as Investment Dries Up
items.summary: The once-thriving UK North Sea oil and gas province survived 2025, the most difficult year since the 1960s when hydrocarbons were first discovered in the basin. Oil and gas production from the mature fields continued to decline last year, while uncer

items.title: US Crude Oil Inventories Sag In First Count of the Year
items.summary: The American Petroleum Institute (API) estimated that crude oil inventories in the United States saw a dip of 2.8 million barrels in the week ending January 2. Crude oil inventories rose by 1.7 million barrels in the week prior. Crude oil inventories

items.title: Chevron Keeps Venezuelan Oil Flowing as Asia Shipments Stall
items.summary: Venezuela’s beleaguered oil export system is narrowing rapidly around Chevron as shipments to its largest traditional customer in China remain stalled amid an intensified U.S. oil embargo and mounting geopolitical upheaval. Shipping data as of Januar
